oai_dc:dc.dc:title: OFFSHORE BREAKWATER, WHEATLY, ONTARIO
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Beaulieu, G.T.
Skafel, M.G.
Baird, W.F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breakwater
offshore breakwater
Wheatley
Ontario
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The safe entry during storms to the fishing harbour at Wheatley on Lake Erie was compromised by breaking waves at the harbour entrance. These waves approach the entrance from a narrow easterly sector due to storm tracks, fetch limitations, and refraction. Using a physical model, a small offshore breakwater was selected as the best solution to eliminate the breaking waves. During the six years since construction, the breakwater has performed satisfactorily and has had a negligible effect on the littoral processes as determined from regular bathymetric surveys.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 129
